subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tap sound
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_000F_01C9E109.A0A60580
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yes, I agree that it may be possible to have PK events occur remotely. 

On=
ce we have ruled out all mundane explanations, and we think we have actual =
paranormal phenomena, then we consider what type of paranormal phenomena we=
 are dealing with.

The problem with remote PK energy is that it is extreme=
ly rare, at least when it is without conscious intent. It is so rare, that =
it only exists in theory pretty much. It is a WAY more common occurrence th=
at when we find any type of PK energy, it occurs only when the subject is p=
resent.

----- Original Message ----- 
  From: phenom_investigator 
  To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, May 30, 2009 7:15 AM
  Subject: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: Tap sound





  It is not commonly understood that PK events =
do not require a local PK agent. While this is the far more common phenomen=
on, it is by no means the only way in which these events can manifest. I pe=
rsonally have conducted rigorous remote PK experiments many times over the =
years. This remote intention as it has come to be called is quiet real and =
remarkably replicable with the right people. This validated phenomena actua=
lly explains quite a few cases that are generally attributed to other, some=
times far more bizarre causes.

  Of course it makes sense to look for natu=
ral causes. However it is appropriate to consider alternatives if you have =
fail to locate plausible physical causations.

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
  >
  > There is absolutely no=
 evidence pointing towards PK phenomena. The homeowners were not present du=
ring the investigation. These surges can easily be explained as mundane and=
 therefore we must assume it is. If we can't rule out all mundane sources, =
then we have to assume it is not paranormal.
  > 
  > These were electrical=
 surges. The only time we had EMF spikes was when these taps would be heard=
. The meter would spike, and then immediately return to 0.
  > 
  > "Do you=
r readings in your notes? Were you reading electrical or magnetic
  > field=
s? What type of EMF meter were you using?"
  > 
  > Yes we logged all readi=
ngs. We were reading EMF, so a bit of both. We had several types of meters =
present. At one point, we had 2 KII meters a few feet apart in the living r=
oom. On some taps, one would go off, and others, the other one would go off=
. Most spikes fell in the 2.5 mg range, but a couple went off the scale.
  =
> 
  > It also explains some of the other activity the homeowners complaine=
d about-the touch lamp, kitchen lights dimming, etc.
  > 
  > Again, these =
surges were constant, though not uniform.
  > 
  > April
  > 
  > ----- Ori=
ginal Message ----- 
  > From: phenom_investigator 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com 
  > Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 10:04 AM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] =
Re: Tap sound
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > What I have been hearing on this=
 since the first posting is a single
  > tap that sounds like wood on wood.=
 Since the tapping was continual
  > and you noticed an EM spike there is a=
nother possibility.
  > 
  > You could have detected a PK event. In polterg=
eist cases we have come
  > to realize that living PK agents often are resp=
onsible. These agents
  > function in environments with specific characteri=
stics and themselves
  > exhibit specific traits. One of the environmental =
characteristics is
  > an elevated magnetic field. Often this is a geomagne=
tic field as seems
  > to be the case in extreme poltergeist cases. Less ex=
tremem cases, 
  > such as this may be, we often see elevated EM field leve=
ls. Do your
  > readings in your notes? Were you reading electrical or magn=
etic
  > fields? What type of EMF meter were you using? This might help
  >=
 determine if the info you noticed was potentially related to PK
  > effect=
s.
  > 
  > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@> wr=
ote:
  > >
  > > Let's try it again.
  > >
  >
